intro: Orchis kromayeri, commonly known as the Kromayer's orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species found primarily in the Balkan region. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and a single, showy flower with a distinctive violet-blue hue. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, showcasing its intricate floral structure. It thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
